p: Wild-type C57BL/6 mice (6 to 8 weeks old; catalog no. 5653791, RRID MGI:5653791) were purchased from Vital River (Beijing, China) and divided into two groups (5 mice per group) based on whether drug was administered by intraperitoneal (i.p.) injection or by gavage. A control group was administered vehicle. Mice were intratracheally instilled with live H5N1 virus (10 6 50% tissue culture infectious doses [TCID 50]), and they received drug or vehicle at 4 time points: 24 h and 3 h before and 24 h and 48 h after infection. Drug administration methods and concentrations are listed in Table S3. Mice were sacrificed at 3 days after viral infection, and bilateral lungs were collected to assess lung injury and pulmonary edema ( 33). The animal experiments in this work were approved by the Ethics Committee of the Institute of Basic Medical Sciences, Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences (ACUC-A02-2017-014) and adhered to the Chinese National Guidelines for the Care of Laboratory Animals and the Institutional Animal Care.
